alternatives.transcript: today on the American debate smoking in public places with John bands have executive director of action on smoking and health and and Browder assistant to the president of the tobacco Institute now here's the moderator of the American debate Robert Kaiser welcome to the American debate where you can hear an informed argument sometimes a heated argument about an important issue in the news

today we're going to talk about a subject that is almost as divisive as religion or politics smoking should the government do more to ban smoking in public places to protect those who don't smoke from the health hazards and annoyances of tobacco smoke or to put it another way should the government intrude on the personal decisions of Americans who like to smoke no matter what the have it might do to them should the government fight smoking or quit meddling our Debaters are going to talk about smoking on airline flights of less than two hours because the Civil aeronautics

sport is considering a request to ban all smoking on those flights but I hope we'll go beyond that to the general question of what the proper governmental role is in this whole area today we will consider the resolution resolved and smoking should be banned on short airplane flights our Debaters we'll take turns presenting their arguments then they will question each other and finally each will sum up John banzhaf is the executive director and chief counsel of action on smoking and health a non-profit group has changed

to protect the rights of the non-smoking majority he's also a professor of law at the National Law Center disturbance a fuel begin Bob action on smoking and health along with a number of health organizations the Department of Transportation the American Medical Association and a number of consumer groups has proposed to the Civil Aeronautics board that advanced smoking on short flights the board is more than considering it they have tentatively voted 40 to adopt that proposal

as we View at the question is not so much whether we should ban smoking on short flights but rather why we permit smoking on airplanes after at all because after all we do ban it in so many other public places where people are required to sit or congregate next to one another churches movie theaters legitimate theaters public transit systems many other areas despite the different smoking and no smoking sections now required by CA B rules tobacco smoke drifts and is recirculate and it is now

record before the ca B before a congressional hearing and by several different findings that this causes serious health problems for many Americans who have a variety of physical conditions and annoyance and irritation for the majority of passengers who are non-smokers why then do we permit at all the answer would seem to be because if we banned it for long periods of time it would create a problem for those who do smoke regularly and in many cases are addicted so as should propose the idea of banning smoking on short flights that

that of two hours or less we feel a two hours is a good Norm because that's usually the time for a movie it's the time you may spend on a transit system or in church or in a courtroom or many other areas we know that smokers can and do refrain from smoking for that period of time the other reason for preferring to hours over 1 hour is that if you have a ban only for one hour to too easy for the airlines to avoid it by taking 59 minutes schedules and making them 61 minute schedules

we hope that the ca B will adopt this and by the way smoking non-smoking is not as divisive as you said initially the polls indicate that the majority of smokers as well as non smokers tend to favor increased restrictions on smoking in public places that's what we're concerned with protecting the right of the nonsmoker to breathe air unpolluted by tobacco smoke okay thank you very much and Browder is assistant to the president of the tobacco Institute but she's work since 1976 The Institute is the trade Association

in cigarette manufacturers for joining me Institute is broader worked at NBC News is broader it's your turn thank you I think it's important to point out that the present rules of the Civil Aeronautics board reflect to very sound principles they are that the board has responsibilities to all of the passengers involved and any travel on any aircraft the non-smoking as well as the smoking passengers

and secondly that competing Airlines has the discretion to adopt their services to Consumer demand and I think with the 1979 or 1978 rather Act of deregulation of airlines that many airlines now feel the need to operate their aircraft as they see fit in order to accommodate the passengers in December of 1983 the Civil Aeronautics board received over

10,000 letters in response to a request as to whether or not they should make any changes in the present smoking and non-smoking Arrangements on board aircraft 68% of those respondents stated that they oppose any changes whatsoever in the present system the present system is a workable system certainly there are Travelers who are smokers and travelers who are non-smokers the smoking passengers do not get any discount if they are denied the right

right to engage in a perfectly legal custom and our society mr. bands after me overlooks the fact in spite of the fact that the 1971 study which was commissioned by various Departments of our government H ew the Federal Aviation Administration Department of Transportation and several other agencies showed that there was indeed on board aircraft most major aircraft in this country

a complete change of air every 3 to 4 minutes despite what he says and his petitions to the see a be there is recirculation of air Air does not drift to the fore and aft section of the cabins I'm a very frequent traveler myself traveling up to 80,000 miles a year I've never seen anyone complaining about problems on board an aircraft because of smoking or non-smoking jurisdictions I think the present situation is workable we should leave it as it is

is for the benefit of all passengers involved and not just for the Avid anti smokers or as I refer to them John banzhaf and his Raiders thank you very much now we'll go to some questions and answers and mix it up a bit as well you have the first question for mr. you want to come in and not discuss the issue but a few my motives and say bands after prohibitionist bands F wants to ban smoking all over the country I've stated many times in many forms on radio TV and in print that neither I nor action on smoking health is interested in a Prohibition on smoking in this country or anywhere else that so far as we are concerned if adults choose to smoke knowing the risks if they do so in a place and in a situation where they do not infringe upon the rights of others I have absolutely no

to that end we have turned down proposed legal actions that might even have moved in the direction of prohibition what we're talking about here is not a Prohibition of smoking on airplanes rather is in the nature of a compromise we could ban smoking on all airplanes as indeed many of the smaller carriers have as indeed Muse Airlines has as indeed a number of other carriers around the world have and indeed as more and more businesses and other places are doing it from the give me you he's going to do that what do you mean you could do that I don't understand that I wish would have my answer

sure I'm going to ask the next question for this reason we're asking for ban only on flights of two hours or less because we feel this is a reasonable compromise based upon the needs of the smoke compromise and the requirements of the smoker and our social Customs we are not pushing here for ban on smoking we didn't push in San Francisco for a ban on smoking and I'm sure you can't name a single situation where I have ever any lawsuit administrative proceeding or any debate asked for a total ban on smoking in Europe

my question would be better off if we had a band in your opening statement my question have on man you start out asking for to our bands and then you'll come back and you'll ask for a total ban on all and I think here the question is why does the smoker supposedly have this right that you seem to think he has as you know the fifth Circuit Court of Appeals has just ruled there's no right to smoke on an airplane many are carriers totally banned smoking many of the larger ones indeed also ban the smoking of cigars

why is there a need to provide for the smoker and say not others who have very similar habits for example if I want to chew and spit tobacco get exactly the same tobacco satisfaction as a smoker certainly you wouldn't argue that the airlines have to accommodate me or the government has to take into account my preference and have a chunin smitten section or if another very close analogy of closest to I can think of if I desired to burn incense and inhale the aroma of it on during the flight I'm sure I wouldn't be allowed on any Airline

decided by a vote or a pole or in terms of the absolute numbers I wonder if you would apply that in other areas you know at one time in this country blacks were discriminated against and if we took a vote probably the great majority of people in certain areas of the country would have said well that's fine that's all right there are many Industries today where women are in the minority or sexual harassment is an issue as you took a vote among coal miners and many others and said are there enough protections for these women they'd say sure and the number of complaints are very very small but the
